titleStmt.title: An exact relation of the delivering up of Reading to His Excellencie the Earl of Essex; and how the Kings forces have quitted Cyrencester and Brill: with the true relation of the fight at Caversham. As it was sent in a letter to the speaker of the House of Commons, by these worthy members of the said House: Sir Philip Stapleton, John Hampden, and Arthur Goodwin, Esquires. Ordered by the Commons assembled in Parliament, that this letter be forthwith printed and published. Hen: Elsynge Cler. Parl. D. Com.
titleStmt.author: Stapleton, Philip, Sir, 1603-1647.

titleStmt.title: An exact relation of the delivering up of Reading to His Excellencie the Earl of Essex; and how the Kings forces have quitted Cyrencester and Brill: with the true relation of the fight at Caversham. As it was sent in a letter to the speaker of the House of Commons, by these worthy members of the said House: Sir Philip Stapleton, John Hampden, and Arthur Goodwin, Esquires. Ordered by the Commons assembled in Parliament, that this letter be forthwith printed and published. Hen: Elsynge Cler. Parl. D. Com.
titleStmt.author: Stapleton, Philip, Sir, 1603-1647.
Goodwin, Arthur, 1593 or 4-1643.
Hampden, John, 1594-1643.
England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Edw. Husbands, and are to be sold at his shop in the middle Temple,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
